source_sentence: 佛說舍利弗悔過經
translation: Sutra of Śāriputra's repentance

source_sentence: 後漢安息國三藏安世高譯
translation: Translated by An Shigao, the Tripiṭaka Master of Anxi in the Later Han Dynasty

source_sentence: 佛在羅閱祇耆闍崛山中，時與千二百五十比丘菩薩千人共坐。
translation: When the Buddha was on Mount Rājagṛdhrakūṭa, he sat with a thousand people of one thousand two hundred and fifty monks and bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 第一弟子舍利弗起前長跪，叉手問佛言：「若有善男子、善女人意欲求佛道，若前世為惡，當何用悔之乎？」
translation: The first disciple, Śāriputra, got up and knelt down in front of him, saluted the Buddha with his palms together, asked, If good men and good women want to pursue the Buddha's path, what will be the use of repentance if they did evil in a previous life?

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉善哉！
translation: The Buddha said, Good, good!

source_sentence: 舍利弗！
translation: Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 憂念諸天人民好乃如是。」
translation: So it is with the goodness of the gods and people who grieve for the gods.

source_sentence: 佛言：「若有善男子、善女人，欲求阿羅漢道者、欲求辟支佛道者、欲求佛道者、欲知去來之事者，常以平旦、日中、日入、人定、夜半、雞鳴時，澡漱整衣服，叉手禮拜十方。
translation: The Buddha said, Suppose there are good men and good women who want to pursue the path of the arhats, those who want to pursue the path of the pratyekabuddhas, those who want to pursue the path of the buddhas, and those who want to know the events of past and future lives. They should always bathe and wash their clothes at sunrise, noon, in the middle of the day, when the sun enters

source_sentence: 自在所向，當悔過言：『某等宿命從無數劫以來所犯過惡，至今世所犯婬妷、所犯瞋怒、所犯愚癡，不知佛時、不知法時、不知比丘僧時、不知善惡時。
translation: They should repent of their past sins and say, 'Suppose someone commits evil for countless eons in a past life that's been committed since countless eons; they don't know the time of the Buddha, the time of the Dharma, the time of the monks, the time of the bhikṣus, or the time of the good and bad.

source_sentence: 若身有犯過，若口犯過、若心犯過、若意犯過，若意欲害佛、嫉惡經道、若鬪比丘僧、若殺阿羅漢、若自殺父母。
translation: If someone commits an offense in body, they commit an offense in speech, an offense in mind, or an offense in intention, and if they want to harm the Buddha, become jealous of the sūtras and paths, fight a monk or saṃgha, kill an arhat, or kill their parents.

source_sentence: 若犯身三、口四、意三，自殺生、教人殺生、見人殺生代其喜；
translation: If someone commits one of the three forms of transgression, bodily, verbal, or mental: taking life by force of death; telling others to take life; and rejoicing in their place when they see another taking life.

source_sentence: 身自行盜、教人行盜、見人行盜代其喜；
translation: Stealing on one’s own, encouraging others to steal, and seeing others steal instead delight in it.

source_sentence: 身自欺人、教人欺人、見人欺人代其喜；
translation: They deceive others by themselves, teach others to deceive others, and rely on others to deceive them.

source_sentence: 身自兩舌、教人兩舌、見人兩舌代其喜；
translation: They speak falsely of themselves, teach falsely, and seek falsehood in order to please others.

source_sentence: 身自罵詈、教人罵詈、見人罵詈代其喜；
translation: They scold themselves, teach others to scold them, and on seeing others scold them they rejoice in their behalf.

source_sentence: 身自妄言、教人妄言、見人妄言代其喜；
translation: “Great enlightening beings speak falsely of themselves, teach falsely, and seek falsehood in order to please others.

source_sentence: 身自嫉妬、教人嫉妬、見人嫉妬代其喜；
translation: They become jealous of themselves, teach others to be jealous, and on behalf of those who are jealous they gladden their joy.

source_sentence: 身自貪飻、教人貪飻、見人貪飻代其喜；
translation: The enlightening beings themselves are greedy and covetous, teach others to be greedy and covetous, and on seeing others’ greed and covetousness they rely on their delight.

source_sentence: 身自不信、教人不信、見人不信代其喜；
translation: They themselves do not believe in it, teach others not to believe in it, and on seeing others who do not believe in it they gladden their joy.

source_sentence: 身不信作善得善作惡得惡、見人作惡代其喜；
translation: Their bodies did not believe in doing what was good and obtaining what was good, doing what was bad and getting what was bad. When they saw someone doing evil, they relied on him for his joy.

source_sentence: 身自盜佛寺中神物若比丘僧財物、教人行盜、見人行盜代其喜；
translation: They themselves steal the spiritual property of buddha- temples. If they steal the property of monks and nuns, or teach others to steal, or see others steal on their behalf, they will be delighted.

source_sentence: 身自輕稱小斗短尺欺人、以重稱大斗長尺侵人、見人侵人代其喜；
translation: They despise themselves as small dots, short feet, and deceive others; they attack others with heaps, large dots, long feet, and flatter them.

source_sentence: 身自故賊、教人故賊、見人故賊代其喜；
translation: Thieves of their own accord, thieves of teaching others, and thieves of seeing others delight in them instead.

source_sentence: 身自惡逆、教人惡逆、見人惡逆代其喜。
translation: They commit harmful acts on their own, teach others to commit harmful acts, and rely on the joy of seeing others' harmful acts.

source_sentence: 身諸所更以來生五處者，在泥犁中時、在禽獸中時、在薜荔中時、在人中時，身在此五道中生時所犯過惡，不孝父母、不孝於師、不敬於善友、不敬於善沙門道人、不敬長老，輕易父母、輕易於師父、輕易求阿羅漢道者、輕易求辟支佛道者、若誹謗嫉妬之。
translation: Those whose bodies have been born in five places since then are those who commit crimes when they're born in niraya, among animals, among cattle, among humans, or among people, who aren't filial to their parents, aren't filial to their teacher, don't respect good friends, don't respect the well-versed ascetic, don't respect the elders, despise their parents, despise

source_sentence: 見佛道言非、見惡道言是、見正言不正、見不正言正。
translation: Seeing the Buddha's path is said to be wrong, seeing bad paths is said to be right, seeing what's right is not right, and seeing what's not right is called right.

source_sentence: 某等諸所作過惡，願從十方諸佛求哀悔過，令某等今世不犯此過殃，令某等後世亦不被此過殃。
translation: May I ask the buddhas of the ten directions to take pity on me and repent of my faults, so that I won't commit these faults in this life and so that I won't be subject to these faults in a later life.

source_sentence: 所以從十方諸佛求哀者何？
translation: Why do you ask for pity from the buddhas of the ten directions?

source_sentence: 佛能洞視徹聽，不敢於佛前欺。
translation: The Buddha can penetrate and listen, so he doesn't dare to deceive them in front of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 某等有過惡不敢覆藏，從今以後皆不敢復犯。』」
translation: 'Some of you have faults and bad qualities that you won't cover up, and from now on you won't dare to violate them again.'

source_sentence: 佛語舍利弗：「若有善男子、善女人，意不欲入泥犁、禽獸、薜荔中者，諸所作過皆當悔過之，不當覆藏，受戒以後不當復作惡。
translation: The Buddha said to Śāriputra, If there are good men and good women whose minds don't want to enter the mud plows, animals, or streamers, they should repent of their faults, not hide them, and after receiving the precepts, they won't do evil again.

source_sentence: 不欲生邊地無佛處、無經處、無比丘僧處、無義理處、善惡處者，皆當悔過，不當覆藏。
translation: Those who don't want to be born in a marginal land where there's no Buddha place, no sūtra place, no monk's or nun's place, no meaningful place, and no place of goodness or evil will all repent and not hide.

source_sentence: 意不欲愚癡聾盲瘖瘂、不欲生屠生漁獵獄吏更生貧家，皆當悔過，不當覆藏。
translation: Their minds don't want to be ignorant, deaf, blind, or dumb, and they don't want to be born in a butchering, fishing, hunting, or prison officials to be reborn in a poor home, so they must repent and not hide it.

source_sentence: 女人欲求男子者，皆當悔過。
translation: Women who want to seek men will all repent.

source_sentence: 欲得須陀洹道不復入泥犁薜荔中者，皆當悔過。
translation: Those who want to attain the path of stream entry and don't go back into nirvāṇa, they'll all repent.

source_sentence: 欲得斯陀含道上天作人、欲得阿那含道上二十四天、欲得阿羅漢泥洹去者，欲於世間得阿羅漢道者、欲得辟支佛道者、欲知去來之事者，皆當悔過，不當覆藏。」
translation: Those who want to attain the twenty-four heavens above the once-returner path, those who want to attain arhatship and nirvāṇa in the world, those who want to attain the path of arhatship in the world, those who want to attain the path of pratyekabuddhahood, and those who want to know the events of past and future will all repent and not hide.

source_sentence: 佛語舍利弗：「若有善男子、善女人，各當日三稽首，為十方現在諸佛作禮。
translation: The Buddha said to Śāriputra, If there are good men and good women, each will bow three times a day and pay homage to the buddhas present in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 十方諸佛皆以中正迴教天下人，日月所照人民使作善。
translation: The buddhas of the ten directions all teach the people of the world correctly by means of the middle way, and the people illuminated by the sun and moon are made to do good.

source_sentence: 佛以經道雨於天下，譬如天雨百穀草木皆茂好。
translation: The Buddha used the sūtras and paths to rain down rain on the world, just as the gods rain a hundred grains and grass and trees all grow luxuriantly.

source_sentence: 佛以經道雨於天下，故生侯王、四天王，上至三十三天上豪貴富樂。
translation: Because the Buddha rained the sūtras and paths on the world, princes and four heavenly kings were born there, up to the top of the thirty-three gods, who were wealthy and prosperous.

source_sentence: 佛生須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢者，願十方諸佛聽某等所言：『天下人民蜎飛蠕動之類所作好惡，若布施者、若持道勤力不毀經戒者、若慈心念人民者、若作善無量者、若施於菩薩及諸比丘僧者、若施凡夫及貧窮者、下至禽獸慈哀者，某等勸其作善助其歡喜。
translation: When the Buddha gives birth to stream entrants, sakṛdāgāmins, non-returners, and arhats, may the buddhas of the ten directions hear what someone says, 'The people of the world do good and evil like flying birds and wriggling creatures, whether they give generosity, maintain the path with diligence and not disparage the sūtras and precepts, are kind and mindful of

source_sentence: 諸過去佛所可過度人民得泥洹者，某等皆助其歡喜。
translation: 'The buddhas of the past can go beyond people who attain nirvāṇa, and I'll help them rejoice.'

source_sentence: 諸當來佛教人作善、遠離五惡生死之道，至令得阿羅漢辟支佛道者，某等皆助某等勸樂，使作善令如佛。
translation: In the future, Buddhist people who do good and part with the five bad paths of birth-and-death will attain the path of arhatship and pratyekabuddhahood, so that they'll all help certain people encourage them to do good and make them become buddhas.

source_sentence: 今十方現在諸佛所當過度者，教人布施不犯經戒、慈哀人民蜎飛蠕動之類者，皆令脫於泥犁、禽獸、薜荔、愚癡貧窮，至令得須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、阿羅漢、辟支佛泥洹道，某等皆勸樂使作善助其歡喜。
translation: Now, the buddhas of the ten directions will now go beyond them, teaching people to give alms without violating the sūtras or precepts, kindly pitying people who fly and wriggle, causing them to be freed from the poverty of niraya, animals, turtles, and foolishness, until they attain the path of stream entry, sakṛdāgāmin, non-returner, arhat, pratye

source_sentence: 諸過去菩薩未成佛者，奉行六波羅蜜所作善，行檀波羅蜜布施、行尸波羅蜜不犯道禁、行羼提波羅蜜忍辱、行精進波羅蜜精進、行禪波羅蜜一心、行般若波羅蜜智慧，成六波羅蜜。
translation: Those bodhisattvas of the past who hadn't yet become buddhas were those who practiced the six perfections and did good deeds, practiced generosity based on the perfection of giving, practiced morality without violating the precepts, practiced tolerance based on the perfection of forbearance based on pity, practiced effort based on the perfection of effort, practiced meditation based on the perfection of one-point

source_sentence: 諸過去若菩薩奉行六波羅蜜，某等勸樂助其歡喜。
translation: If bodhisattvas in the past had practiced the six perfections, certain people would have encouraged and helped them rejoice.

source_sentence: 諸當來菩薩奉行六波羅蜜者，某等勸樂助其歡喜。
translation: When future bodhisattvas consecrate the six perfections, certain people encourage and help them rejoice.

source_sentence: 今現在菩薩奉行六波羅蜜者，某等勸樂助其歡喜。
translation: Now, a bodhisattva who consecrates the six perfections will be encouraged by someone to help him rejoice.

source_sentence: 某等諸所得福，皆布施天下十方人民父母、蜎飛蠕動之類、兩足之類、四足之類、多足之類，皆令得佛。』
translation: All the merits that I've attained are given to the people and parents of the ten directions in the world, such as birds flying and wriggling, two-legged creatures, four-legged creatures, and many-legged creatures, so that they'll attain Buddhahood.'

source_sentence: 福得辟支人、持四大城金銀寶物持用布施，百倍千倍萬倍億倍。」
translation: The merit obtained by a pratyekabuddha who carries the four great treasures of gold and silver from the four great cities and uses them for generosity is a hundredfold, a thousandfold, a thousandfold, a millionfold, and a billionfold.

source_sentence: 佛語舍利弗：「若有善男子、善女人，當晝夜各當三過稽首，為十方佛拜言：『願聽某等所言。
translation: The Buddha said to Śāriputra, Suppose there are good men and good women who, day and night, bow down three times each day with their heads bowed to the buddhas of the ten directions and say, 'May I hear what you say?'

source_sentence: 十方佛已得佛不說經，今某等勸勉，使為諸天人民、蜎飛蠕動之類說經，使脫於泥犁、禽獸、薜荔、愚癡貧窮，至令得泥洹道。
translation: Having already attained buddhahood, the buddhas of the ten directions won't teach the sūtras, and now certain people are encouraged to teach the sūtras for gods and people who fly and wriggle, so that they'll be freed from the poverty of mud plows, animals, turtles, and foolishness until they attain the path of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 諸十方欲般泥洹者，某等願從求哀且莫般泥洹，當令諸天人民、蜎飛蠕動之類得其福，皆令得脫於泥犁、薜荔。』」
translation: Those in the ten directions who want to partake of nirvāṇa, may I ask them to beg for pity and don't partake of nirvāṇa, so that gods, people, birds, flying creatures, and wriggling creatures will all attain their merit and be freed from the mud plows and fig trees.'

source_sentence: 佛語舍利弗：「某等宿命為菩薩時，某等當勸樂諸佛說經，且莫般泥洹。
translation: The Buddha said to Śāriputra, When you were bodhisattvas in a previous life, you must encourage the buddhas to teach the sūtras and not enter final nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 用是故某等為佛。
translation: It's because they use this as a reason for certain people to become buddhas.

source_sentence: 第一四天王、第二天王釋來下，叉手作禮求哀，守我諸天人民說經。
translation: The first four heavenly kings and the second heavenly king Śakra came down to pay their respects with palms joined and begged for mercy, guarding us gods and people to preach the sūtras.

source_sentence: 無數諸天曉我，且莫般泥洹。」
translation: Countless gods will awaken to me, so don't parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 佛語舍利弗言：「如是人民種種各得其類，作善自得其福、作惡自得其殃。」
translation: The Buddha said to Śāriputra, Thus, various kinds of people attain their own kinds of goodness and badness by doing what's good, and they attain their own misfortune by doing evil.

source_sentence: 舍利弗白佛言：「若有善男子、善女人，欲求佛道者，當何以願為得之？」
translation: Śāriputra said to the Buddha, If there are good men and good women who want to pursue the Buddha Way, how will they attain it by wishing for it?

source_sentence: 佛言：「若有善男子、善女人，當晝夜各三稽首，為十方佛拜言：『願十方諸佛聽。
translation: The Buddha said, Suppose there are good men and good women who, day and night, make obeisance to the buddhas of the ten directions three times each day and night, saying, 'May the buddhas of the ten directions listen.'

source_sentence: 某等宿命從無數劫以來所作得福，若布施、若持經道、若持善意、為佛作善、為經作善、為比丘僧作善、為凡人作善、若為禽獸作善作惡自得其殃，作善自得其福、為惡自悔。
translation: If someone's past lives have been good since countless eons, they'll attain merit if they make donations, maintain the sūtras and paths, maintain good intentions, do good for the Buddha, do good for the sūtras, do good for monks and nuns, do good for ordinary people, and do good for birds and animals to obtain their own bad fortune, which will bring their own merit and repentance for

source_sentence: 持經戒不毀，若受戒不與女人通，若勸樂諸佛菩薩萬民作善，若勸勉諸佛且莫般泥洹。
translation: If he observes the sūtras and precepts without disparaging them, doesn't give them to women if he receives the precepts, encourages the buddhas and bodhisattvas of myriad people to perform good deeds, and encourages the buddhas not to enter parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 某等取諸學道以來所得福德，皆集聚合會，以持好心施與天下十方人民父母、蜎飛蠕動之類，皆令得其福。
translation: They all gathered together and gave their good intentions to the people of the world in the ten directions, their parents, birds, insects, and wriggling creatures, so that they'd all attain their merit.

source_sentence: 有餘少所令某得之，令某等作佛道行佛經，諸未度者某當度之，諸未脫者某等當脫之，諸未得泥洹者某等當令得泥洹。』」
translation: There are few other things that cause certain people to attain it, causing certain people to create buddha paths and practice buddha scriptures, those who haven't yet liberated themselves will be liberated by certain people, those who haven't yet liberated themselves will be liberated by certain people, and those who haven't yet attained nirvāṇa will be made to attain nirvāṇa.'

source_sentence: 佛語舍利弗言：「使天下男子女人皆為得阿羅漢、辟支佛。
translation: The Buddha said to Śāriputra, So that all the men and women in the world will attain arhatship and pratyekabuddhahood.

source_sentence: 若有人供養天下阿羅漢、辟支佛千歲，其福寧多不？」
translation: If someone were to make offerings to arhats and pratyekabuddhas in the world for a thousand years, wouldn't their merit be great?

source_sentence: 舍利弗言：「但供養一阿羅漢辟支佛一日，其福無量，何況舉天下阿羅漢辟支佛千歲乎？」
translation: Śāriputra said, If you simply make an offering to one arhat or pratyekabuddha for a day, his merit will be immeasurable, so why wouldn't you give it to the worldly arhat or pratyekabuddha who is a thousand years old?

source_sentence: 佛言：「其供養天下阿羅漢辟支佛千歲，不如持悔過經晝夜各三過讀一日，其得福勝供養天下阿羅漢、辟支佛，百倍千倍萬倍億倍。」
translation: The Buddha said, If someone were to make offerings to the arhats and pratyekabuddhas of the world for a thousand years, they wouldn't be able to recite the sūtras with repentance three times each day and night for one day, and their merit would be greater than that of making offerings to the arhats and pratyekabuddhas of the world by a hundredfold, a thousandfold, a thousandfold

source_sentence: 佛說舍利弗悔過經
translation: Sutra of Śāriputra's repentance
